On 1/5/07, Scott Glaser <sglaser@...> wrote:
>
> If your QA team =
wants to have some automated functional tests I don't
> think
> JUnit would=
 the right tool. They would be better off using a tool for
> acceptance or =
GUI testing. For web testing tools I would suggest Selenium
> or
> Canoo We=
bTest. If you need to hook it into JUnit then maybe httpunit or
> jwebunit =
would work but you will be burdened with maintenance if your QA
> team can'=
t develop in Java.


And of course, TestNG, which lets you specify which gr=
oups you want to
include in your tests at runtime, making it trivial to onl=
y run "unit" ,
"functional" or "database" tests without having to recompile=
 anything.
